input.project_name: UPM-Kyndryl Warwick Low Pressure Hot Water Heating Pump Repair
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):work in progress by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Pump head no.2 of dual heat pump has failed, requires complete overhaul,
scope_of_work.scope:
Contractor to Attend site to isolate and remove pump head no.2. 
Install blanking plate to leave pump set operational
Return pump head to workshop to dismantle and inspect
Supply and install the following items
Mechanical Seal
Pump Shaft
O-rings
Wear ring
Motor Bearings
Rebuild, clean and return pump to site to install
Make all mechanical and electrical connections
Test and commission
scope_of_work.justification: The dual pump assists in suppliying heating to the PH1 building, currently only pump No.1 works, Pump No.2 does not hold presure and has failed, so normally the pumps would be rotated on a weekly basis this can now not be achieved.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Over the long term Pump No. 1 will be running full time and due to the increased work load of the pump this will fail causing the failure to supply heating to the building.

The defined scope of work includes: Contractor to Attend site to isolate and remove pump head no.2.

input.project_name: UPM-Repair of Vehicle Gate - Kyndryl Warwick
input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Brando Dooley DDS (2):offer submitted by Brando Dooley DDS (3):work in progress by Brando Dooley DDS

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem: Motor and gear has failed on site vehicle gate.
scope_of_work.scope:
Contractor to attend site and cordon off where necessary to form a safe working area.
Carry out repairs to 1No electrically operated sliding gate including isolate power to the gate and disconnect all
relevant wiring. Strip out existing faulty parts and supply and fit 1No sliding gate motor complete with built-in
control panel, pinion, limit switch magnets and release key. Also supply and fit 1No large enclosure for the new
motor and control panel. Reconnect all wiring and commission. Test operation and leave in good working order.
On completion clean down work area and remove all waste materials from site.
scope_of_work.justification: Vehicle gate currently chained and padlocked, opening and closing of the gate takes manual intervention. Site security currently have no control over the gate.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: Vehicle gate will require a member of staff to open and close the gate, causing delay in the event of an emergency on site if the emergency services required access.

input.status_history: here is the status change history of project in numbering order(1):billing completed by Marge Hills (2):offer submitted by Marge Hills (3):work in progress by Marge Hills

scope_of_work.notes:
1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process
scope_of_work.problem:
A Safety Electrical Castell Key control system requires installation on T10/T11 Switchboard to ensure the supply Transformers cannot be energised in parallel.
Legacy Switchboard controls need to be confirmed operational to ensure the level of designed resilience can be maintained.
scope_of_work.scope:
Remove redundant equipment and wiring from T10 & T11 switchboard up to the supply fuses/outgoing terminals and to fit 3no. castell lock and keys into T10, T11 main incomers & 1no. Bus section ACB’s within the switchboard.
Confirm the operation on the circuitry of the tripping units and flip/flop controls along with any label updates which may be required.
scope_of_work.justification:
This work is required to ensure T10/T11 transformers cannot be energised in parallel.
Legacy Switchboard controls need to be confirmed operational to ensure the level of designed resilience can be maintained.
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: There is potential for transformers to supply the load in parallel and cause operational and safety issues.

output.overview: Project 'UPM-T10 & T11 Switchboard Modifications' is located in United Kingdom at site N/A, managed by Qwerty for client Kyndryl. Prepared by Marge Hills under internal work order UK-EW-06122022-8851. Current status is 'Work Order Closed'.
output.project_scope:
The scope notes highlight key considerations: 1. Does not include any client contingency 
2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value 
3. Maintenance contract budget variations as a result of project activity will be funded by client through the eBVO process. The problem statement indicates: A Safety Electrical Castell Key control system requires installation on T10/T11 Switchboard to ensure the supply Transformers cannot be energised in parallel.
Legacy Switchboard controls need to be confirmed operational to ensure the level of designed resilience can be maintained.. The defined scope of work includes: Remove redundant equipment and wiring from T10 & T11 switchboard up to the supply fuses/outgoing terminals and to fit 3no. castell lock and keys into T10, T11 main incomers & 1no. Bus section ACB’s within the switchboard.
Confirm the operation on the circuitry of the tripping units and flip/flop controls along with any label updates which may be required.. The justification provided is: This work is required to ensure T10/T11 transformers cannot be energised in parallel.
Legacy Switchboard controls need to be confirmed operational to ensure the level of designed resilience can be maintained.. If not approved, the effect would be: There is potential for transformers to supply the load in parallel and cause operational and safety issues..

scope_of_work.notes:

2. Assumes that CBRE hold the burden of the actual cost whether it is over or under the quotation value

scope_of_work.problem: Following FM Global visit, it was found that the diesel tank pipework needs to be steel pipe in pipe
scope_of_work.scope:
Attend site for induction and sign relevant documents
3 days have been allowed for fabrication and on-site fitting
Fabricate 4 x 2 pipe in pipe for fuel line 
Fabricate 2 x 1 pipe in pipe for fuel return line 
Remove existing to suitable joint and fit new 
Items 1,2,3 & 4
2000L tank hire delivery, collection, pipework, fittings & labour/travel
scope_of_work.justification: The pipework needs to be steel pipe within pipe as required to meet FM Global requirements
scope_of_work.non_approval_effect: It would fail to meet FM Global Insurance requirements
